#6 - So, if the #nonprofits and religious institutions that have to follow the #JohnsonAmendment don't want it repealed, why do it? 

Money. 

Repeal would allow money spent supporting candidates to become tax-deductible for the first time. https://t.co/OhsaDpT3fW

#5 - The #JohnsonAmendment wasn't even a partisan issue until recently. While proposed by and named for LBJ, it was passed by a majority Republican Senate, signed into law by Eisenhower and further strengthened by Pres. Reagan. Both parties have respected this law for 6 decades https://t.co/dAuS18EtzY

#4 - Nonpartisanship is what keeps #nonprofits and religious institutions as the trusted institutions that we need them to be. The #JohnsonAmendment is vital for the work that we do in communities, bringing people together and leaving party labels at the door. https://t.co/exL82Bzl1K

#3 - It is not a religious issue. More than 4,500 religious leaders signed a letter in favor of keeping the #JohnsonAmendment and more than 100 denominations have called for it to remain. Not a single denomination has asked for repeal. https://t.co/3mlw8O4CCp https://t.co/Gx2G8ZFdrr

#2 - The #JohnsonAmendment does not inhibit free speech. Public policy issues can be discussed by religious and #nonprofit leaders. They can also help with nonpartisan voter registration efforts. The only thing they can't do is support or oppose candidates for office. https://t.co/VxKlF5F2FG
